interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Ride Along
Review Date: 2021/02/19
Store: Ice Cube  (Actor, Producer),     Kevin Hart  (Actor),     Tim Story  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["For the past two years, high school security guard Ben (Kevin Hart) has been trying to show decorated detective James (Ice Cube) that he's more than just a video game junkie who's unworthy of James' sister. When Ben finally gets accepted into the police academy, James invites him on a ride-along designed to scare the hell out of him and ultimately demonstrate if Ben has what it takes to take care of his sister. But when the wild night leads them to the most notorious criminal in the city, James will find that his new partner's rapid-fire mouth is just as dangerous as the bullets speeding at it. Also starring John Leguizamo and Laurence Fishburne, Ride Along is an action-packed comedy with big thrills and even bigger laughs.", 'Bonus Content:', 'Gag Reel', 'Gag Reel', 'It Was a Good Day – On the Set of Ride Along', 'It Was a Good Day – On the Set of Ride Along', 'Atlanta: The Character', 'Atlanta: The Character', 'Feature Commentary with Director Tim Story', 'Feature Commentary with Director Tim Story', ']]>']

Despicable Me 3
Steve Carell  (Actor),     Kristen Wiig  (Actor),     Pierre Coffin  (Director),     Kyle Balda  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, Special Editions
["Illumination, who brought moviegoers Despicable Me, Despicable Me 2, and the biggest animated hit of 2015, Minions, continues the story of Gru, Lucy, their adorable daughters—Margo, Edith and Agnes—and the Minions in Despicable Me 3. After he is fired from the Anti-Villain League for failing to take down Balthazar Bratt, the latest bad guy to threaten humanity, Gru finds himself in the midst of a major identity crisis. But when a mysterious stranger shows up to inform Gru that he has a long-lost twin brother—a brother who desperately wishes to follow in his twin's despicable footsteps—one former super-villain will rediscover just how good it feels to be bad.Bonus Content:", 'Deleted Scene with Intro by Dana Gaier', 'Deleted Scene with Intro by Dana Gaier', 'Minion Moments', 'Minion Moments', 'Character Profiles', 'Character Profiles', 'The Making of Despicable Me 3', 'The Making of Despicable Me 3', 'Developing Dru', 'Developing Dru', 'The AVL Files', 'The AVL Files', 'Freedonia Visitors Guide', 'Freedonia Visitors Guide', 'Despicable Me\xa0TV', 'Despicable Me\xa0TV', '"Doowit" Sing-Along', '"Doowit" Sing-Along', '"Yellow Light" Music Video', '"Yellow Light" Music Video', 'Minion Mug Shots', 'Minion Mug Shots', 'Wanted Posters', 'Wanted Posters', 'Mini-Movie: The Secret Life of Kyle', 'Mini-Movie: The Secret Life of Kyle', 'There are multiple versions of this movie cover and each shipment is random. Customers are not guaranteed to receive specific cover or to receive multiple covers with multiple purchases.']

All About the Benjamins (New Line Platinum Series)
Beres, Julianne  (Actor),     Bray, Kevin  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, New Line Platinum Series
['Product Description', 'All About the Benjamins (DVD) (WS)', "There's a lot of money in Miami, but bounty hunter Bucum Jackson (Ice Cube) has yet to claim his share of it. Bucum dreams of opening his own private investigation firm, but right now he's on the trail of slippery con artist Reggie Wright (Mike Epps). Bucum's wild pursuit of Reggie leads to the middle of a multi-million dollar diamond heist, where Reggie's flailing hysteria allows him to avoid capture. Things start to look up for Reggie when he realizes he's the sole winner of a $60 million lottery! Unfortunately, the winning ticket is still in Reggie's wallet ... in the getaway van ... and has been discovered by the diamond thieves. And then Reggie sees Bucum. Bucum may not trust Reggie, but if Reggie's story is true it means a whole lot more than the bail money ... and if it's a scam, Bucum can use Reggie as bait to catch the diamond thieves. Now, either way Bucum can't lose--because, after all, it's All About the Benjamins.", ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "Ice Cube cowrote, produced, and stars in this action caper. Bucum (Cube) is a bounty hunter (get it?) with dreams of big money. Reggie (Mike Epps) is a small-time grifter who also has dreams of big money and is at the top of Bucum's list to boot. Yep, you guessed it: tough guy/funny guy buddy flick.", 'All About the Benjamins', "is pretty much a by-the-numbers piece of work. There's plenty of macho posturing, gunfire, big-ticket items exploding, and curse words inserted into the script in lieu of actual punch lines. The plot has holes big enough to drive a locomotive through, but then again the plot isn't really the point. Epps's attempts at wacky comedy wear thin early on, but Ice Cube does a fine job, and together they do make quite a few moments hit. Best recommended for when you want turn-your-brain-off excitement.", '--Ali Davis']

We absolutely loved this movie. So funny
Great movie. We watch it all the time
You Again
Kristen Bell  (Actor),     Betty White  (Actor),     Andy Fickman  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
["You Again, the nonstop laugh fest, is pure fun that features an all-star cast with comedy pedigrees - including Kristen Bell, Jamie Lee Curtis, Sigourney Weaver and the always outrageous Betty White. For Marnie (Bell), high school was a horror movie, and her brother's wedding is the sequel when her archrival comes back to haunt her as his bride. It's nice girl versus mean girl in this hysterical reunion with the one person Marnie would really like to forget. And if that weren't enough, Marnie's mom (Curtis) reunites with her own high school nemesis (Weaver). Complete with hilarious, never-before-seen bonus material, You Again is one crazy comedy that'll keep you laughing again and again."]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user remains committed to comedy films that explore themes of friendship, female camaraderie, and family dynamics. They are increasingly enthusiastic about action-comedy films, demonstrating a preference for narratives that blend humor with thrilling adventures while keeping a light-hearted tone.

- **Mediums:** Their dedication to physical media continues, with a consistent choice for DVDs in their movie collection.

- **Rating Trend:** Maintaining a high average rating of 5.0 for enjoyable films, the user expresses significant appreciation for content that's both engaging and emotionally resonant. Their latest acquisitions reinforce their enjoyment of light-hearted narratives.

- **Engagement Style:** Their reviews reflect a deep joy in family experiences, especially when shared with their daughter. They exhibit a strong enthusiasm for films that invite repeated viewings, suggesting a talent for selecting emotionally impactful and resonant content.

- **Key Themes:** The user places high value on films that emphasize relationships, humor, and camaraderie. They seek out comedies that balance laughter with heartfelt moments, prioritizing stories that reflect their passion for shared joy and bonding.

In summary, the user displays a consistent preference for light-hearted, comedic content that celebrates life’s relationships, underscoring the importance of fun, adventure, and shared experiences in their viewing choices.
